title: Upload project version response
description: JSON body of the response for the `POST /projects/{project}/version/{version}/upload` endpoint.

presigned_urls.description: Property names are the relative paths of the files inside the project, while the values are the presigned URLs corresponding to those files.

filename.description: Relative path of the file in the project.

url.description: A presigned URL, to be used in a `PUT` request to upload the file specified by `filename`. No authorization headers should be attached to this request. The MD5 checksum in the `md5sum` property should be set as the `Content-MD5` header. The response of the `PUT` may be ignored.

md5sum.description: Base64-encoded MD5 checksum of the file.

links.description: Array of files for which it is possible to create a link to an existing file in the ArtifactDB instance, avoiding the need to upload and store a separate copy.

filename.description: Relative path of the file in the project.

url.description:
Path component containing the parameterized link, which should be appended onto the REST API URL. A `PUT` request should be performed on the full URL; no body is required, but all necessary authorization headers should be added.

A successful request will instruct the backend to create a link from the file specified in the property name to another resource in the ArtifactDB store. The response of the `PUT` may be ignored.

completion_url.description: Path component for the completion endpoint, which should be appended onto the REST API URL. A `PUT` request should be performed on the resulting URL with all required authorization headers - see the documentation for the `PUT /projects{project}/version/{version}/complete` endpoint for required parameters in the body. A successful request will indicate to the backend that the upload of this project's version is complete, allowing downstream indexing tasks to start.

abort_url.description: Path component for the abort endpoint, which should be appended onto the REST API URL. A `PUT` request should be performed on the resulting URL, without any body but with all required authorization headers. A successful request should only be possible before upload completion, and will instruct the backend to delete all resources associated with this upload.
